quizSrc.definition: take advantage of the most up-to-date plugins.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following best explains the difference between syntax and semantics? | A browser may have trouble displaying a page if the syntax is incorrect. | A browser may have trouble displaying a page if the semantics are incorrect. | Syntax and semantics are interchangeable.
quizSrc.definition: A browser may have trouble displaying a page if the syntax is incorrect.

A basic functionality of browsers is to translate HTML documents into viewable webpages. | True | False

An HTML5 tag will always have the same semantic meaning, regardless of the browser being used. | True | False

You should write your code using the Sublime editor if you want an easy way for others to see your webpage. | True | False
The Internet is a type of: | Wide Area Network | Local Area Network | Hypertext Network

There can be only one <body> element in a document. | True | False

The HTML5 headings are block-level elements. | True | False
Attributes consist of a name and a value connected by which symbol(s)? | , | ; | "" | =

Which element creates a numbered list? | bl | li | ul | ol

All links should be in the <nav> element. | True | False

A relative reference includes the URL protocol in the href. | True | False

All HTML elements can have attributes. | True | False

| ; | © | &space; |

quizSrc.definition: Displays the contents of the file.

quizSrc.term: The role of a web accessibility coordinator includes which of the following? (You must select all that apply.) | Evaluates web interfaces for accessibility | Keep pace with changing technology | Helps guide policy and purchasing decisions | Working with W3C to create guidelines for future versions of HTML
quizSrc.definition: Evaluates web interfaces for accessibility | Keep pace with changing technology | Helps guide policy and purchasing decisions

quizSrc.term: Which of the following can affect the visual accessibility of your site? (Select all that apply.) | font size | color contrast | font family | editor choice
quizSrc.definition: font size | color contrast | font family

quizSrc.term: Which of the following can affect the visual accessibility of your site? | Font size, but not font color. | Font color, but not font size | Both font color and font size.
quizSrc.definition: Both font color and font size.

quizSrc.term: The W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines are based on the latest technology. | True | False
The W3 validator will detect if you have bad color contrast on your page. | True | False

Submit the URLs again to the accessibility checker at https://wave.webaim.org/Opens in a new tab. Do you see more or less errors than the w3 validator? |
The W3 validator will detect if you are using the alt attribute in your image tags. | True | False
The Wave validator will detect if you have bad color contrast on your page. | True | False
Adherence to standards is important when trying to improve accessibility. | True | False.
Which fluid measurement type returns a percentage of the viewport width? |

Responsive Web Design is... | Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules. | Designing pages for the mobile view. | Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop)
quizSrc.definition: Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules.

quizSrc.term: Adaptive design with dynamic serving is.... | Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules. | Designing pages for the mobile view. | Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop) and returning the appropriate version based on the device making the page request.
quizSrc.definition: Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop) and returning the appropriate version based on the device making the page request.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is a true statement about using a separate "m." site for your content? | It is difficult to keep multiple versions of your site consistent. Any updates must be made in multiple places. | Some search engines require a .m version of your site. | Users have control over which version of the page they can see, regardless of the device they are using.
quizSrc.definition: It is difficult to keep multiple versions of your site consistent. Any updates must be made in multiple places.

quizSrc.term: The mobile version of your web page should have the same layout of every other version of your site. | True | False

For some CSS properties, negative lengths are allowed. | True | False
1 _____ = 1% of viewport width |
1 _____ = 1% of viewport height
An em is the size of an uppercase M in any typeface, making the size relative to the font. | True | False
Which term matches the browser window size? | width | orientation | viewport

quizSrc.definition: px at the Root, rem for Components, em for Text Elements

quizSrc.definition: software developers are no longer actively supporting it, so its use is discouraged.

The possible values for the prefers-color-scheme CSS media feature include light and dark. | True | False

You can use media queries to change the layout of your page when the orientation of a mobile device changes from portrait to landscape. | True | False

Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M.What is the width of any div elements on a 750px screen? | 100% | 25% | The div won't display since media queries must go at the bottom of the screen. | 80%

Consider the following CSS rule:123456789div{width:80%;}@mediaprint{div{width:25%;}}Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M.Which of the following is a true statement? | The div elements will only visible only when the page is printed | The div elements will have a width of 80% only when the page is printed | The div elements will have a width of 25% only when the page is printed
quizSrc.definition: The div elements will have a width of 25% only when the page is printed

Every valid web page can be represented as a tree. This tree is referred to as the | JavaScript | DOM | API
JavaScript is able to react to most but not all existing HTML events in the page | True | False
JavaScript uses what kind of interface to access the DOM structure? | an API | CSS3 | HTML5

You must include the period when using the getElementsByClassName() method. | True | False
Unless you are writing multiple statements on the same line, you don't need to add a semicolon. | True | B: False
Which of the following is not a valid method for generating output to the screen? | document.write | print | prompt | alert
Which of these options does NOT require the use of parentheses? | innerHTML | prompt | console.log | document.write | alert
Which of the following does not generate output directly to the screen? | console.log(message); | document.write(message); | element.innerHTML = message;
How does prompt differ from alert? | Only prompt uses parentheses. | Only alert uses parentheses. | The alert will return a value, prompt does not. | The prompt will return a value, alert does not.

quizSrc.term: Variables allow you to save data. | True | False
In JavaScript the keywords let and var are used to declare a variable. | True | False

What does it mean that variables are case-sensitive? | That all variables must use lowercase letters | That all variables must use uppercase letters | That the computer does not think that the variables name and Name are the same thing.
quizSrc.definition: That the computer does not think that the variables name and Name are the same thing.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is not a valid variable name? | 1variable | variableOne | variable1 | oneVariable

What does mnemonic mean? | That variable names should start with lowercase letters and use uppercase letters if the variable has multiple parts, e.g. firstName. | That variable names should be as short as possible, preferably with no more than two or three characters. | That variable names should help describe the value being stored.
quizSrc.definition: That variable names should help describe the value being stored.

quizSrc.term: What is wrong with this code? var name = "Mike"; "Colleen" = name; | The variable declaration is illegal. | This code is illegal and it doesn't make sense to have the non-variable "Colleen" (also called a constant) on the left-hand side of an assignment statement. Please review the lecture on Variables from Week 1. | It is illegal to change the value stored in a variable.
quizSrc.definition: This code is illegal and it doesn't make sense to have the non-variable "Colleen" (also called a constant) on the left-hand side of an assignment statement. Please review the lecture on Variables from Week 1.

quizSrc.term: Which attribute is used to link to an external JavaScript file? | file; e.g., file = "extFile.js" | src; e.g., src = "extFile.js" | script; e.g., script = "extFile.js" | href; e.g., href = "extFile.js"
Which word is used to define a function in JavaScript? | function | func | define

Which of the following best defines the difference between defining a function and calling a function? | You can define a function without calling it. | Defining and calling a function are the same thing | You can call a function without it being defined first.
quizSrc.definition: You can define a function without calling it.

What is wrong with the following rule?12345body{color:#000000;background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:Times,Arial,Cursive;}Enter to Rename, Shift+Enter to Preview.monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.focused { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.focused:hover { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.selected { background-color: #0069d1; } .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.selected:hover { background-color: #0069d1; } .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.selected { color: #ffffff; } .monaco-drag-image, .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.selected.focused { background-color: #0074e8; } .monaco-drag-image, .monaco-list.list_id_1:focus .monaco-list-row.selected.focused { color: #ffffff; } .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-row.focused { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-row.focused:hover { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-row.selected { background-color: #e4e6f1; } .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-row.selected:hover { background-color: #e4e6f1; } .monaco-list.list_id_1:not(.drop-target) .monaco-list-row:hover:not(.selected):not(.focused) { background-color: #f0f0f0; } .monaco-list.list_id_1.drop-target, .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-rows.drop-target, .monaco-list.list_id_1 .monaco-list-row.drop-target { background-color: #d6ebff !important; color: inherit !important; } .monaco-list-type-filter { background-color: #efc1ad } .monaco-list-type-filter { border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); } .monaco-list-type-filter.no-matches { border: 1px solid #be1100; } .monaco-list-type-filter { box-shadow: 1px 1px 1px #a8a8a8; }Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M. | You can't specify three styles in a single rule | You can't specify three options for font-family. | Nothing - This is a valid rule
quizSrc.definition: Nothing - This is a valid rule

Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M.What happens if the browser doesn't support any of these font families? | The text will be displayed in the default browser font-family | The text will be displayed in Cursive | The text will not be displayed
quizSrc.definition: The text will be displayed in the default browser font-family

Using the code below, will the body of the page have the background-color defined in the file style.css or the background color defined in the <style> tag?12345678910<head><metacharset="UTF-8"><title>Testcode</title><linkrel"stylesheet"href="style.css"><style>body{background-color:#44CCDD;}</style></head>Enter to Rename, Shift+Enter to Preview.monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.focused { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.focused:hover { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.selected { background-color: #0069d1; } .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.selected:hover { background-color: #0069d1; } .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.selected { color: #ffffff; } .monaco-drag-image, .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.selected.focused { background-color: #0074e8; } .monaco-drag-image, .monaco-list.list_id_3:focus .monaco-list-row.selected.focused { color: #ffffff; } .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-row.focused { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-row.focused:hover { background-color: #d6ebff; } .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-row.selected { background-color: #e4e6f1; } .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-row.selected:hover { background-color: #e4e6f1; } .monaco-list.list_id_3:not(.drop-target) .monaco-list-row:hover:not(.selected):not(.focused) { background-color: #f0f0f0; } .monaco-list.list_id_3.drop-target, .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-rows.drop-target, .monaco-list.list_id_3 .monaco-list-row.drop-target { background-color: #d6ebff !important; color: inherit !important; } .monaco-list-type-filter { background-color: #efc1ad } .monaco-list-type-filter { border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); } .monaco-list-type-filter.no-matches { border: 1px solid #be1100; } .monaco-list-type-filter { box-shadow: 1px 1px 1px #a8a8a8; }Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M. | <style> | style.css

The default display value for paragraphs is: | inline-block | none | block | inline
The default display value for <span> is: | inline-block | inline | block | none
A block element takes up the full width of its parent, even if the content is smaller than the parent. So two block elements at the same time will not be side-by-side. | True | False
Inline elements take up the full width of the browser, even if the content is smaller than the browser size. | True | False

quizSrc.definition: Using semantic tags in addition to color and/or font.
